tasks.name: NuGetPublisher
tasks.description: Deprecated: use the “NuGet” task instead. It works with the new Tool Installer framework so you can easily use new versions of NuGet without waiting for a task update, provides better support for authenticated feeds outside this organization/collection, and uses NuGet 4 by default.
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627417) or [see the NuGet documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/)
tasks.author: Lawrence Gripper

inputs.name: searchPattern
inputs.label: Path/Pattern to nupkg
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pattern to match or path to nupkg files to be uploaded. Multiple patterns can be separated by a semicolon.

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: NuGet Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet server generic service connection, set the key 'Password/Token Key' field to your NuGet API key.

inputs.name: feedName
inputs.label: Internal Feed URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL of a NuGet feed hosted in this account.

inputs.name: nuGetAdditionalArgs
inputs.label: NuGet Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to NuGet.exe push. [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-push).

inputs.name: verbosity
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: NuGet's verbosity level

inputs.name: nuGetVersion
inputs.label: NuGet Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of NuGet to use, or custom version.

inputs.name: nuGetPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to NuGet.exe. Will override version selection.

inputs.name: continueOnEmptyNupkgMatch
inputs.label: Continue if no packages match the "Path/Pattern to nupkg"
inputs.helpMarkDown: Continue instead of fail if no packages match the "Path/Pattern to nupkg".

tasks.name: queryWorkItems
tasks.description: Execute a work item query and check the number of items returned
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: queryId
inputs.label: Query
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a saved work item query to execute.

inputs.name: maxThreshold
inputs.label: Upper threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum number of matching workitems from the query.

inputs.name: minThreshold
inputs.label: Lower threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: The minimum number of matching workitems from the query.

Execute.Expression: xor(and(or(eq(root['queryType'], 'oneHop'), eq(root['queryType'], 'tree')), and(le(count(root['workItemRelations']), $(maxThreshold)), ge(count(root['workItemRelations']), $(minThreshold)))), and(eq(root['queryType'], 'flat'), and(le(count(root['workItems']), $(maxThreshold)), ge(count(root['workItems']), $(minThreshold)))))

outputVariables.name: AppServiceApplicationUrl
outputVariables.description: Application URL of the selected App Service.

tasks.name: AzureWebAppContainer
tasks.description: Deploy containers to Azure App Service
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: azureSubscription
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: App name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select the name of an existing Azure App Service. App services based on selected app type will only be listed.

inputs.name: deployToSlotOrASE
inputs.label: Deploy to Slot or App Service Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the option to deploy to an existing deployment slot or Azure App Service Environment.
For both the targets, the task needs Resource group name.
In case the deployment target is a slot, by default the deployment is done to the production slot. Any other existing slot name can also be provided.
In case the deployment target is an Azure App Service environment, leave the slot name as ‘production’ and just specify the Resource group name.

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The Resource group name is required when the deployment target is either a deployment slot or an App Service Environment.
Enter or Select the Azure Resource group that contains the Azure App Service specified above.

inputs.name: slotName
inputs.label: Slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select an existing Slot other than the Production slot.

inputs.name: imageName
inputs.label: Image name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the fully qualified container image name. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest' or 'python:3.7.2-alpine/'. For multi-container scenario multiple container image names can be provided.

inputs.name: multicontainerConfigFile
inputs.label: Configuration File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the Docker-Compose file. Should be a fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory.

inputs.name: containerCommand
inputs.label: Startup command
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter the start up command. For ex.
dotnet exec filename.dll
dotnet filename.dll

inputs.name: appSettings
inputs.label: App settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app application settings following the syntax -key value . Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -Port 5000 -RequestTimeout 5000
-WEBSITE_TIME_ZONE "Eastern Standard Time"

inputs.name: configurationStrings
inputs.label: Configuration settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app configuration settings following the syntax -key value. Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -phpVersion 5.6 -linuxFxVersion: node|6.11

tasks.instanceNameFormat: Azure Web App on Container Deploy: $(appName)

tasks.name: SqlDacpacDeploymentOnMachineGroup
tasks.description: Deploy a SQL Server database using DACPAC or SQL scripts
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: TaskType
inputs.label: Deploy SQL Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the way in which you want to deploy DB, either by using Dacpac or by using Sql Script.

inputs.name: DacpacFile
inputs.label: DACPAC File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the DACPAC file on the target machines or on a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.dacpac. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported, like $env:windir, $env:systemroot, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\DB. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/*.dacpac` for DACPAC file present in all sub folders.

inputs.name: SqlFile
inputs.label: Sql File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the SQL file on the target. Provide semi-colon separated list of SQL script files to execute multiple files. The SQL scripts will be executed in the order given. Location can also be a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.sql. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported, like $env:windir, $env:systemroot, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\DB. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/*.sql` for sql file present in all sub folders.

inputs.name: ExecuteInTransaction
inputs.label: Execute within a transaction
inputs.helpMarkDown: Executes SQL script(s) within a transaction

inputs.name: ExclusiveLock
inputs.label: Acquire an exclusive app lock while executing script(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Acquires an exclusive app lock while executing script(s)

inputs.name: AppLockName
inputs.label: App lock name
inputs.helpMarkDown: App lock name

inputs.name: InlineSql
inputs.label: Inline Sql
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sql Queries inline

inputs.name: TargetMethod
inputs.label: Specify SQL Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the option to connect to the target SQL Server Database. The options are either to provide the SQL Server Database details, or the SQL Server connection string, or the Publish profile XML file.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SQL Server name like, machinename\FabriakmSQL,1433 or localhost or .\SQL2012R2. Specifying localhost will connect to the Default SQL Server instance on the machine.
inputs.visibleRule: TargetMethod = server || TaskType = sqlQuery || TaskType = sqlInline

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the SQL Server database.
inputs.visibleRule: TargetMethod = server || TaskType = sqlQuery || TaskType = sqlInline

inputs.name: AuthScheme
inputs.label: Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mode for connecting to the SQL Server. In Windows authentication mode, the account used to configure deployment agent, is used to connect to the SQL Server. In SQL Server Authentication mode, the SQL login and Password have to be provided in the parameters below.
inputs.visibleRule: TargetMethod = server || TaskType = sqlQuery || TaskType = sqlInline

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: SQL User name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SQL login to connect to the SQL Server. The option is only available if SQL Server Authentication mode has been selected.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: SQL Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the Password of the SQL login. The option is only available if SQL Server Authentication mode has been selected.

inputs.name: ConnectionString
inputs.label: Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the SQL Server connection string like "Server=localhost;Database=Fabrikam;User ID=sqluser;Password=password;".

inputs.name: PublishProfile
inputs.label: Publish Profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish profile provide fine-grained control over SQL Server database deployments. Specify the path to the Publish profile XML file on the target machine or on a UNC share that is accessible by the machine administrator's credentials.

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional SqlPackage.exe arguments that will be applied when deploying the SQL Server database like, /p:IgnoreAnsiNulls=True /p:IgnoreComments=True. These arguments will override the settings in the Publish profile XML file (if provided).

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsSql
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd arguments that will be applied when deploying the SQL Server database.

tasks.name: CacheBeta
tasks.description: Cache files between runs
tasks.helpMarkDown: Improve build performance by caching files, like dependencies, between pipeline runs.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: key
inputs.label: Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Key (unique identifier) for the cache. This should be a string that can be segmented using '|'. File paths can be absolute or relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: path
inputs.label: Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the folder to cache. Can be fully-qualified or relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory). Wildcards are not supported. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) are supported.

inputs.name: cacheHitVar
inputs.label: Cache hit variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Variable to set to 'true' when the cache is restored (i.e. a cache hit), otherwise set to 'false'.

inputs.name: restoreKeys
inputs.label: Additional restore key prefixes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional restore key prefixes that are used if the primary key misses. This can be a newline-delimited list of key prefixes.

inputs.label: Mobile Center Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Visit https://mobile.azure.com/settings/profile to set your password. It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'. You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: appSlug
inputs.label: App Slug
inputs.helpMarkDown: The app slug is in the format of {username}/{app_identifier}.  To locate {username} and {app_identifier} for an app, click on its name from https://mobile.azure.com/apps, and the resulting url is in the format of https://mobile.azure.com/users/{username}/apps/{app_identifier}.

inputs.name: devices
inputs.label: Devices
inputs.helpMarkDown: String to identify what devices this test will run against.  Copy and paste this string when you define a new test run from Mobile Center Test beacon.

inputs.name: series
inputs.label: Test Series
inputs.helpMarkDown: The series name for organizing test runs (e.g. master, production, beta).

inputs.name: dsymDir
inputs.label: dSYM Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to iOS symbol files.

inputs.name: locale
inputs.label: System Language
inputs.helpMarkDown: If your language isn't displayed, select 'Other' and enter its locale below, such as en_US.

inputs.name: userDefinedLocale
inputs.label: Other Locale
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter any two-letter ISO-639 language code along with any two-letter ISO 3166 country code in the format [language]_[country], such as en_US.

inputs.name: loginOpts
inputs.label: Addtional Options for Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to mobile-center login step.

inputs.name: runOpts
inputs.label: Additional Options for Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to mobile-center test run.

inputs.name: async
inputs.label: Do not wait for test result
inputs.helpMarkDown: Execute command asynchronously, exit when tests are uploaded, without waiting for test results.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.label: Enable Debug Output
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add --debug to mobile-center cli.

tasks.name: DownloadSecureFile

tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.label: Secure File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file name or GUID of the secure file to download to the agent machine. The file will be deleted after the pipeline runs.

inputs.name: retryCount
inputs.label: Retry Count

inputs.name: socketTimeout

inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional timeout for a socket associated with downloading secure file request in ms.

tasks.name: AzureContainerApps
tasks.description: An Azure DevOps Task to build and deploy Azure Container Apps.
tasks.releaseNotes: Released new AzureContainerApps task for building and deploying Azure Container Apps.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run.  Empty is the root of the repo (build) or artifacts (release), which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)

inputs.name: appSourcePath
inputs.label: Application source path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path on the runner of the source application code to be built. If not provided, the 'imageToDeploy' argument must be provided to ensure the Container App has an image to reference.

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Resource Manager connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Manager service connection for the deployment

inputs.name: acrName
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Container Registry that the runnable application image will be pushed to.

inputs.name: acrUsername
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The username used to authenticate push requests to the provided Azure Container Registry. If not provided, an access token will be generated via 'az acr login' and provided to 'docker login' to authenticate the requests.

inputs.name: acrPassword
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password used to authenticate push requests to the provided Azure Container Registry. If not provided, an access token will be generated via 'az acr login' and provided to 'docker login' to authenticate the requests.

inputs.name: dockerfilePath
inputs.label: Dockerfile path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path to the Dockerfile in the provided application source that should be used to build the image that is then pushed to ACR and deployed to the Container App. If not provided, this task will check if there is a file named 'Dockerfile' at the root of the provided application source and use that to build the image. Otherwise, the Oryx++ Builder will be used to create the image.

inputs.name: imageToBuild
inputs.label: Docker image to build
inputs.helpMarkDown: The custom name of the image that is to be built, pushed to ACR and deployed to the Container App by this task. Note: this image name should include the ACR server; e.g., <acr-name>.azurecr.io/<repo>:<tag>. If this argument is not provided, a default image name will be constructed in the form of `<acr-name>.azurecr.io/ado-task/container-app:<build-id>.<build-number>`.

inputs.name: imageToDeploy
inputs.label: Docker image to deploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: The custom name of the image that has already been pushed to ACR and will be deployed to the Container App by this task. Note: the image name should include the ACR server; e.g., <acr-name>.azurecr.io/<repo>:<tag>. If this argument is not provided, the value provided (or determined) for the 'imageToBuild' argument will be used.

inputs.name: containerAppName
inputs.label: Azure Container App name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Container App that will be created or updated. If not provided, this value will be in the form of `ado-task-app-<build-id>-<build-number>`.

inputs.name: resourceGroup
inputs.label: Azure resource group name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The existing resource group that the Azure Container App will be created in. If not provided, this value will be `<container-app-name>-rg` and its existence will first be checked before attempting to create it.

inputs.name: containerAppEnvironment
inputs.label: Azure Container App environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure Container App environment to use with the application. If not provided, an existing environment in the resource group of the Container App will be used, otherwise, an environment will be created in the form of `<container-app-name>-env`.

inputs.name: runtimeStack
inputs.label: Application runtime stack
inputs.helpMarkDown: The platform version stack that the application runs in when deployed to the Azure Container App. This should be provided in the form of `<platform>:<version>`. If not provided, this value is determined by Oryx based on the contents of the provided application. Please view the following document for more information on the supported runtime stacks for Oryx: https://github.com/microsoft/Oryx/blob/main/doc/supportedRuntimeVersions.md

inputs.name: targetPort
inputs.label: Application target port
inputs.helpMarkDown: The designated port for the application to run on. If no value is provided and the builder is used to build the runnable application image, the target port will be set to 80 for Python applications and 8080 for all other platform applications. If no value is provided when creating a Container App, the target port will default to 80. Note: when using this task to update a Container App, the target port may be updated if not provided based on changes to the ingress property.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: Location of the Container App
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location that the Container App (and other created resources) will be deployed to.

inputs.name: environmentVariables
inputs.label: Environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of environment variable(s) for the container. Space-separated values in 'key=value' format. Empty string to clear existing values. Prefix value with 'secretref:' to reference a secret.

inputs.name: ingress
inputs.label: Ingress setting
inputs.helpMarkDown: Possible options: external, internal, disabled. If set to `external` (default value if not provided when creating a Container App), the Container App will be visible from the internet or a VNET, depending on the app environment endpoint configured. If set to `internal`, the Container App will be visible from within the app environment only. If set to `disabled`, ingress will be disabled for this Container App and will not have an HTTP or TCP endpoint.

inputs.name: yamlConfigPath
inputs.label: YAML configuration file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path (on the executing Azure Pipelines agent) to the YAML file detailing the configuration of the Container App.

inputs.name: disableTelemetry
inputs.label: Disable telemetry
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to 'true', no telemetry will be collected by this Azure DevOps Task. If set to 'false', or if this argument is not provided, telemetry will be sent to Microsoft about the Container App build and deploy scenario targeted by this Azure DevOps Task.

Please view the following document for more information on the supported runtime stacks for Oryx: https://github.com/microsoft/Oryx/blob/main/doc/supportedRuntimeVersions.md

inputs.name: targetPort
inputs.label: Application target port
inputs.helpMarkDown: The designated port for the application to run on. If no value is provided and the builder is used to build the runnable application image, the target port will be set to 80 for Python applications and 8080 for all other platform applications. If no value is provided when creating a Container App, the target port will default to 80. Note: when using this task to update a Container App, the target port may be updated if not provided based on changes to the ingress property.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: Location of the Container App
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location that the Container App (and other created resources) will be deployed to.

inputs.name: environmentVariables
inputs.label: Environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of environment variable(s) for the container. Space-separated values in 'key=value' format. Empty string to clear existing values. Prefix value with 'secretref:' to reference a secret.

inputs.name: ingress
inputs.label: Ingress setting
inputs.helpMarkDown: Possible options: external, internal, disabled. If set to `external` (default value if not provided when creating a Container App), the Container App will be visible from the internet or a VNET, depending on the app environment endpoint configured. If set to `internal`, the Container App will be visible from within the app environment only. If set to `disabled`, ingress will be disabled for this Container App and will not have an HTTP or TCP endpoint.

inputs.name: yamlConfigPath
inputs.label: YAML configuration file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path (on the executing Azure Pipelines agent) to the YAML file detailing the configuration of the Container App.

inputs.name: disableTelemetry
inputs.label: Disable telemetry
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to 'true', no telemetry will be collected by this Azure DevOps Task. If set to 'false', or if this argument is not provided, telemetry will be sent to Microsoft about the Container App build and deploy scenario targeted by this Azure DevOps Task.

outputVariables.name: rubyLocation
outputVariables.description: The resolved folder of the Ruby distribution.

tasks.name: UseRubyVersion
tasks.description: Use the specified version of Ruby from the tool cache, optionally adding it to the PATH
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2005989) or [see the Ruby documentation](https://www.ruby-lang.org/)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version range or exact version of a Ruby version to use.

inputs.name: addToPath
inputs.label: Add to PATH
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepend the retrieved Ruby version to the PATH environment variable to make it available in subsequent tasks or scripts without using the output variable.

tasks.name: Grunt
tasks.description: Run the Grunt JavaScript task runner
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627413) or [see the Grunt documentation](https://gruntjs.com/getting-started)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: gruntFile
inputs.label: Grunt File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the grunt file script file to run.

inputs.name: targets
inputs.label: Grunt Task(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional.  Space delimited list of tasks to run.  If not specified, the default task will run.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments passed to grunt.  --gruntfile is not needed since already added via gruntFile input above.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory when script is run.  Defaults to the folder where the script is located.

inputs.name: gruntCli
inputs.label: grunt-cli location
inputs.helpMarkDown: grunt-cli to run when agent can't find global installed grunt-cli  Defaults to the grunt-cli under node_modules folder of the working directory.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to Azure Pipelines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Grunt build to Azure Pipelines.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test Results Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test Run Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: enableCodeCoverage
inputs.label: Enable Code Coverage
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to enable Code Coverage using Istanbul.

inputs.name: testFramework
inputs.label: Test Framework
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select your test framework.

inputs.name: srcFiles
inputs.label: Source Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the path to your source files which you want to hookRequire()

inputs.name: testFiles
inputs.label: Test Script Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the path to your test script files

outputVariables.name: SqlDeploymentOutputFile
outputVariables.description: Generated output file path when deployment package action is either of Extract, Export, Script, Drift Report, Deploy Report.

tasks.name: SqlAzureDacpacDeployment
tasks.description: Deploy an Azure SQL Database using DACPAC or run scripts using SQLCMD
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Classic Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Azure Classic subscription for deploying SQL files

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Azure Resource Manager subscription for deploying SQL files

inputs.name: AuthenticationType
inputs.label: Authentication Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the option to connect to the Azure SQL Server Database. The options are either to provide the Azure SQL Server Database details, or the SQL Server connection string, or AAD Authentication password or integrated or use a Service Principal. For SQL server authentication, use SQL server's user credentials and for AD authentication, use credentials of AD user configured to SQL server.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Azure SQL Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure SQL Server name, like Fabrikam.database.windows.net,1433 or Fabrikam.database.windows.net.
inputs.visibleRule: AuthenticationType = server || AuthenticationType = aadAuthenticationPassword || AuthenticationType = aadAuthenticationIntegrated || AuthenticationType = servicePrincipal

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Azure SQL Database, where the files will be deployed.
inputs.visibleRule: AuthenticationType = server || AuthenticationType = aadAuthenticationPassword || AuthenticationType = aadAuthenticationIntegrated || AuthenticationType = servicePrincipal

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Azure SQL Server administrator login.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for the Azure SQL Server administrator.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: aadSqlUsername
inputs.label: Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Active directory username.

inputs.name: aadSqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for the Active directory user.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: ConnectionString
inputs.label: Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Azure SQL Server connection string like "Server=testServer.database.windows.net;Database=testdb;User ID=sqluser;Password=$(securePassword);".

inputs.name: DeploymentAction
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose one of the SQL Actions from the list. For more details refer link.​

inputs.name: DacpacFile
inputs.label: DACPAC File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the DACPAC file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.dacpac. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.
inputs.visibleRule: DeploymentAction = Publish || DeploymentAction = Script || DeploymentAction = DeployReport

inputs.name: BacpacFile
inputs.label: BACPAC File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the BACPAC file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.bacpac. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.

inputs.name: SqlFile
inputs.label: SQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the SQL script file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.sql. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.

inputs.name: SqlInline
inputs.label: Inline SQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the SQL script to execute on the Database selected above.

inputs.name: PublishProfile
inputs.label: Publish Profile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Publish profile provides fine-grained control over Azure SQL Database creation or upgrades. Specify the path to the Publish profile XML file on the automation agent or on a UNC share. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.buildDirectory) or $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.
inputs.visibleRule: TaskNameSelector = DacpacTask || DeploymentAction = Script || DeploymentAction = DeployReport

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional SqlPackage.exe Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional SqlPackage.exe arguments that will be applied when deploying the Azure SQL Database, in case DACPAC option is selected like, /p:IgnoreAnsiNulls=True /p:IgnoreComments=True. These arguments will override the settings in the Publish profile XML file (if provided).
inputs.visibleRule: TaskNameSelector = DacpacTask || DeploymentAction = Extract || DeploymentAction = Export || DeploymentAction = Import || DeploymentAction = Script || DeploymentAction = DeployReport || DeploymentAction = DriftReport

inputs.name: SqlAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd arguments that will be applied when executing the given SQL query on the Azure SQL Database like, -ConnectionTimeout 100 -OutputSqlErrors.

inputs.name: InlineAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Invoke-Sqlcmd arguments that will be applied when executing the given SQL query on the Azure SQL Database like, -ConnectionTimeout 100 -OutputSqlErrors

inputs.name: IpDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: For the task to run, the IP Address of the automation agent has to be added to the 'Allowed IP Addresses' in the Azure SQL Server's Firewall. Select auto-detect to automatically add firewall exception for range of possible IP Address of automation agent or specify the range explicitly.

inputs.name: StartIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50.

inputs.name: EndIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65.

inputs.name: DeleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, then after the task ends, the IP Addresses specified here are deleted from the 'Allowed IP Addresses' list of the Azure SQL Server's Firewall.

tasks.name: ContainerStructureTest
tasks.description: Uses container-structure-test (https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/container-structure-test) to validate the structure of an image based on four categories of tests - command tests, file existence tests, file content tests and metadata tests
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: dockerRegistryServiceConnection
inputs.label: Docker registry service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: repository
inputs.label: Container repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the repository.

inputs.name: tag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: The tag is used in pulling the image from docker registry service connection

inputs.name: configFile
inputs.label: Config file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Config files path, that contains container structure tests. Either .yaml or .json files

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the Test Run.

inputs.name: failTaskOnFailedTests
inputs.label: Fail task if there are test failures
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the task if there are any test failures. Check this option to fail the task if test failures are detected.

tasks.name: IISWebAppDeployment
tasks.description: Deploy using MSDeploy, then create/update websites and app pools
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: WinRMProtocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the protocol to use for the WinRM connection with the machine(s). Default is HTTPS.

inputs.name: TestCertificate
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate by a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: WebDeployPackage
inputs.label: Web Deploy Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the Web Deploy (MSDeploy) zip file on the target machines or on a UNC path like, \\\\BudgetIT\WebDeploy\WebDeployPackage.zip. The UNC path should be accessible to the machine's administrator account. Environment variables are also supported like, $env:windir, $env:systemroot, like, $env:windir\FabrikamFibre\Web.

inputs.name: WebDeployParamFile
inputs.label: Web Deploy Parameter File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the Parameter file on the target machines or on a UNC path. Parameter file is used to override Web application configuration settings like, IIS Web application name or database connection string.

inputs.name: OverRideParams
inputs.label: Override Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Parameters specified here will override the parameters in the MSDeploy zip file and the Parameter file. To override more than one parameter use line separator, e.g.,
"IIS Web Application Name"="Fabrikam"
"ConnectionString"="Server=localhost;Database=Fabrikam;"

inputs.name: CreateWebSite
inputs.label: Create or Update Website
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create a website or to update an existing website.

inputs.name: WebSiteName
inputs.label: Website Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the IIS website that will be created if it does not exist, or it will be updated if it is already present on the IIS server. The name of the website should be same as that specified in the web deploy zip package file. If a Parameter file and override Parameters setting is also specified, then the name of the website should be same as that in the override Parameters setting.

inputs.name: WebSitePhysicalPath
inputs.label: Physical Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Physical path where the website content is stored. The content can reside on the local computer or on a remote directory or share like, C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: WebSitePhysicalPathAuth
inputs.label: Physical Path Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authentication mechanism for accessing the physical path of the website.

inputs.name: WebSiteAuthUserName
inputs.label: User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: User name for accessing the website's physical path.

inputs.name: WebSiteAuthUserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for accessing the website's physical path. If you are using a gMSA, this is not required.

inputs.name: AddBinding
inputs.label: Add Binding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to add port binding for the website.

inputs.name: AssignDuplicateBinding
inputs.label: Assign Duplicate Binding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to add the bindings specified here, even if there is another website with the same bindings. If there are binding conflicts, then only one of the website will start.

inputs.name: Protocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select HTTP for the website to have an HTTP binding, or select HTTPS for the website to have a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) binding.

inputs.name: IPAddress
inputs.label: IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type an IP address that users can use to access this website. If All Unassigned is selected, the site will respond to requests for all IP addresses on the port and the optional host name that is specified for this site, unless another site on the server has a binding on the same port but with a specific IP address.

inputs.name: Port
inputs.label: Port
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type the port on which Hypertext Transfer Protocol Stack (HTTP.sys) must listen for requests made to this website.

inputs.name: ServerNameIndication
inputs.label: Server Name Indication Required
inputs.helpMarkDown: Determines whether the website requires Server Name Indication (SNI). SNI extends the SSL and TLS protocols to indicate what host name the client is attempting to connect to. It allows multiple secure websites with different certificates to use the same IP address.

inputs.name: HostNameWithOutSNI
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: To assign one or more host names (or domain names) to a computer that uses a single IP address, type a host name here. If a host name is specified then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithHttp
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: To assign one or more host names (or domain names) to a computer that uses a single IP address, type a host name here. If a host name is specified then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithSNI
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: To assign one or more host names (or domain names) to a computer that uses a single IP address, type a host name here. If a host name is specified then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: SSLCertThumbPrint
inputs.label: SSL Certificate Thumb Print
inputs.helpMarkDown: Thumb-print of the Secure Socket Layer certificate that the website is going to use. The certificate should be already installed on the machine and present under the Local Computer, Personal store.

inputs.name: CreateAppPool
inputs.label: Create or Update Application Pool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create an application pool or to update an existing application pool.

inputs.name: AppPoolName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the IIS application pool to create or update. Existing application pool will be updated with the settings specified here.

inputs.name: DotNetVersion
inputs.label: .NET Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of the .NET Framework that is loaded by this application pool. If the applications assigned to this application pool do not contain managed code, select the No Managed Code option from the list.

inputs.name: PipeLineMode
inputs.label: Managed Pipeline Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Managed pipeline mode specifies how IIS processes requests for managed content. Use classic mode only when the applications in the application pool cannot run in the Integrated mode.

inputs.name: AppPoolIdentity
inputs.label: Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the account under which an application pool's worker process runs. Select one of the predefined security accounts or configure a custom account.

inputs.name: AppPoolPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you are using a gMSA, this is not required.

inputs.name: AppCmdCommands
inputs.label: Additional AppCmd.exe Commands
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Additional AppCmd.exe commands to set website or application pool properties. For more than one command use line separator, e.g.,
list apppools
list sites

inputs.name: DeployInParallel
inputs.label: Deploy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will deploy the Web application in-parallel on the target machines.

inputs.name: ResourceFilteringMethod
inputs.label: Select Machines By
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally, select a subset of machines either by providing machine names or tags.

inputs.name: MachineFilter
inputs.label: Deploy to Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: This input is valid only for machine groups and is not supported for flat list of machines or output variables yet. Provide a list of machines like, dbserver.fabrikam.com, webserver.fabrikam.com, 192.168.12.34, or tags like, Role:DB; OS:Win8.1. If multiple tags are provided, then the task will run in all the machines with the specified tags. For Azure Resource Groups, provide the virtual machine's name like, ffweb, ffdb. The default is to run the task in all machines.

tasks.name: CloudLoadTest
tasks.description: Run a load test in the cloud with Azure Pipelines
tasks.helpMarkDown: This task triggers a cloud-based load test using Azure Pipelines. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=546976)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Pipelines Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a previously registered service connection to talk to the cloud-based load test service. Choose 'Manage' to register a new service connection.

inputs.name: TestDrop
inputs.label: Load test files folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Output path where the load test and supporting files including plugins and data files are available.
  • Build Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\LoadTestproject\bin\$(BuildConfiguration)
  • Release Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\SourceCI\drop\LoadTestproject\bin\Release
    where SourceCI is the source alias and drop is artifact name

inputs.name: LoadTest
inputs.label: Load test file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The load test filename to be used from the load test files folder specified.

options.useFile: As specified in the load test file

inputs.name: activeRunSettings
inputs.label: Active Run Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the active run settings as specified in the file (values can be overridden) or change the active run setting for the load test file.

inputs.name: runSettingName
inputs.label: Specify the name of the Run Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the run setting that will be made active

inputs.name: testContextParameters
inputs.label: Override load test context parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override test context parameters defined in the load test. For example: `-parameter1 value1 -parameter2 "value with spaces"

inputs.name: TestSettings
inputs.label: Test settings file
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The testsettings file name to be used from the load test folder specified above or a full path.
  • Build Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\LoadTestproject\bin\$(BuildConfiguration)\load.testsettings
  • Release Example:
    $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\SourceCI\drop\LoadTestproject\bin\Release\load.testsettings
    where SourceCI is the source alias and drop is artifact name

inputs.name: ThresholdLimit
inputs.label: Number of permissible threshold violations
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of threshold violations above which the load test outcome is considered unsuccessful.

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group rig
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of Resource group hosting the self-provisioned rig of load test agents.

inputs.name: numOfSelfProvisionedAgents
inputs.label: Number of agents to use
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of self-provisioned agents to use for this test.

tasks.name: KubectlInstaller
tasks.description: Install Kubectl on agent machine
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851275) or [see the Kubernetes documentation](https://kubernetes.io/docs/home/)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: kubectlVersion
inputs.label: Kubectl Version Spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the version of Kubectl to install

tasks.name: CmdLine

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script

echo Write your commands here

inputs.name: failOnStderr

inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

tasks.name: CmdLine

inputs.name: filename

Tool name to run. Tool should be found in your path. Optionally, a fully qualified path can be supplied but that relies on that being present on the agent.
Note: You can use **$(Build.SourcesDirectory)**\\ if you want the path relative to repo.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the tool. Use double quotes to escape spaces.

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

tasks.name: NuGet
tasks.description: Deprecated: use the “NuGet” task instead. It works with the new Tool Installer framework so you can easily use new versions of NuGet without waiting for a task update, provides better support for authenticated feeds outside this organization/collection, and uses NuGet 4 by default.

Install will install packages from a packages.config file. Use this option if you want to install a standalone tool package.

inputs.name: solution

inputs.name: selectOrConfig

tasks.name: NuGetCommand
tasks.description: Restore, pack, or push NuGet packages, or run a NuGet command. Supports NuGet.org and authenticated feeds like Azure Artifacts and MyGet. Uses NuGet.exe and works with .NET Framework apps. For .NET Core and .NET Standard apps, use the .NET Core task.
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613747) or [see the NuGet documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet command to run. Select 'Custom' to add arguments or to use a different command.

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Path to solution, packages.config, or project.json
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the solution, packages.config, or project.json file that references the packages to be restored.

inputs.name: selectOrConfig
inputs.label: Feeds to use
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can either select a feed from Azure Artifacts and/or NuGet.org here, or commit a nuget.config file to your source code repository and set its path here.

inputs.name: feedRestore
inputs.label: Use packages from this Azure Artifacts/TFS feed. Select from the dropdown or enter [project name/]feed name.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include the selected feed in the generated NuGet.config. You must have Azure Artifacts installed and licensed to select a feed here.

inputs.name: includeNuGetOrg
inputs.label: Use packages from NuGet.org
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include NuGet.org in the generated NuGet.config.

inputs.name: nugetConfigPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet.config in your repository that specifies the feeds from which to restore packages.

inputs.name: externalEndpoints
inputs.label: Credentials for feeds outside this organization/collection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Credentials to use for external registries located in the selected NuGet.config. For feeds in this organization/collection, leave this blank; the build’s credentials are used automatically.

inputs.name: noCache
inputs.label: Disable local cache
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prevents NuGet from using packages from local machine caches.

inputs.name: disableParallelProcessing
inputs.label: Disable parallel processing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prevents NuGet from installing multiple packages in parallel.

inputs.name: packagesDirectory
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the folder in which packages are installed. If no folder is specified, packages are restored into a packages/ folder alongside the selected solution, packages.config, or project.json.

inputs.name: verbosityRestore
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: searchPatternPush
inputs.label: Path to NuGet package(s) to publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pattern to match or path to nupkg files to be uploaded. Multiple patterns can be separated by a semicolon.

inputs.name: feedPublish
inputs.label: Target feed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a feed hosted in this account. You must have Azure Artifacts installed and licensed to select a feed here.

inputs.name: publishPackageMetadata
inputs.label: Publish pipeline metadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: Associate this build/release pipeline’s metadata (run #, source code information) with the package

inputs.name: allowPackageConflicts
inputs.label: Allow duplicates to be skipped
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If you continually publish a set of packages and only change the version number of the subset of packages that changed, use this option. It allows the task to report success even if some of your packages are rejected with 409 Conflict errors.

This option is currently only available on Azure Pipelines and using Windows agents. If NuGet.exe encounters a conflict, the task will fail. This option will not work and publish will fail if you are within a proxy environment.

inputs.name: externalEndpoint
inputs.label: NuGet server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet service connection that contains the external NuGet server’s credentials.

inputs.name: verbosityPush
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: searchPatternPack
inputs.label: Path to csproj or nuspec file(s) to pack
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Pattern to search for csproj directories to pack.

You can separate multiple patterns with a semicolon, and you can make a pattern negative by prefixing it with '!'. Example: `**\*.csproj;!**\*.Tests.csproj`

inputs.name: configurationToPack
inputs.label: Configuration to package
inputs.helpMarkDown: When using a csproj file this specifies the configuration to package

inputs.name: outputDir
inputs.label: Package folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where packages will be created. If empty, packages will be created at the source root.

inputs.name: versioningScheme
inputs.label: Automatic package versioning
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Cannot be used with include referenced projects. If you choose 'Use the date and time', this will generate a [SemVer](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)-compliant version formatted as `X.Y.Z-ci-datetime` where you choose X, Y, and Z.

If you choose 'Use an environment variable', you must select an environment variable and ensure it contains the version number you want to use.

If you choose 'Use the build number', this will use the build number to version your package. **Note:** Under Options set the build number format to be '[$(BuildDefinitionName)_$(Year:yyyy).$(Month).$(DayOfMonth)$(Rev:.r)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627416)'.

inputs.name: includeReferencedProjects
inputs.label: Include referenced projects
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include referenced projects either as dependencies or as part of the package. Cannot be used with automatic package versioning. If a referenced project has a corresponding nuspec file that has the same name as the project, then that referenced project is added as a dependency. Otherwise, the referenced project is added as part of the package. [Learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-pack).

inputs.name: versionEnvVar
inputs.label: Environment variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the variable name without $, $env, or %.

inputs.name: requestedMajorVersion
inputs.label: Major
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'X' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: requestedMinorVersion
inputs.label: Minor
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Y' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: requestedPatchVersion
inputs.label: Patch
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'Z' in version [X.Y.Z](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html)

inputs.name: packTimezone
inputs.label: Time zone
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the desired time zone used to produce the version of the package. Selecting UTC is recommended if you're using hosted build agents as their date and time might differ.

inputs.name: includeSymbols
inputs.label: Create symbols package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies that the package contains sources and symbols. When used with a .nuspec file, this creates a regular NuGet package file and the corresponding symbols package.

inputs.name: toolPackage
inputs.label: Tool Package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Determines if the output files of the project should be in the tool folder.

inputs.name: buildProperties
inputs.label: Additional build properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a list of token=value pairs, separated by semicolons, where each occurrence of $token$ in the .nuspec file will be replaced with the given value. Values can be strings in quotation marks.

inputs.name: basePath
inputs.label: Base path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The base path of the files defined in the nuspec file.

inputs.name: verbosityPack
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the amount of detail displayed in the output.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Command and arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The command and arguments which will be passed to NuGet.exe for execution. If NuGet 3.5 or later is used, authenticated commands like list, restore, and publish against any feed in this organization/collection that the Project Collection Build Service has access to will be automatically authenticated.

tasks.name: Delay
tasks.description: Delay further execution of a workflow by a fixed time
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: delayForMinutes
inputs.label: Delay Time (minutes)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delay the execution of the workflow by specified time in minutes. 0 value means that workflow execution will start without delay.

tasks.name: XamariniOS
tasks.description: Build an iOS app with Xamarin on macOS
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root of the Xamarin.iOS solution to build. May contain wildcards.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Standard configurations are Ad-Hoc, AppStore, Debug, Release.

inputs.name: clean
inputs.label: Clean
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run a clean build (/t:clean) prior to the build.

inputs.name: packageApp
inputs.label: Create app package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether an IPA should be generated as a part of the build.

inputs.name: forSimulator
inputs.label: Build for iOS Simulator
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally build for the iOS Simulator instead of physical iOS devices.

inputs.name: runNugetRestore
inputs.label: Run NuGet restore
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally run `nuget restore` on the Xamarin iOS solution to install all referenced packages before build. The 'nuget' tool in the PATH of the build agent machine will be used. To use a different version of NuGet or set additional arguments, use the [NuGet Installer Task](https://www.visualstudio.com/docs/build/steps/package/nuget-installer).

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional command line arguments that should be used to build.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory in which builds will run. When empty, the root of the repository is used.

inputs.name: mdtoolLocation
inputs.label: Build tool path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to xbuild (the Xamarin Studio mono build tool) or MSBuild (the Visual Studio for Mac build tool). When empty, the default xbuild or MSBuild path is used.

inputs.name: signMethod
inputs.label: Override using
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the build should use a signing or provisioning method that is different than the default, choose that method here. Choose 'File Contents' to use a P12 certificate and provisioning profile. Choose 'Identifiers' to retrieve signing settings from the default Keychain and pre-installed profiles. Leave the corresponding fields blank if you do not wish to override default build settings.

inputs.name: iosSigningIdentity
inputs.label: Signing identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally override the signing identity that will be used to sign the build. If nothing is entered, the setting in the Xcode project will be used. You may need to select 'Unlock Default Keychain' if you use this option.

inputs.name: unlockDefaultKeychain
inputs.label: Unlock default keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Resolve "User interaction is not allowed" errors by unlocking the default keychain.

inputs.name: defaultKeychainPassword
inputs.label: Default keychain password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to unlock the default keychain when that option is set.

inputs.name: provProfileUuid
inputs.label: Provisioning profile UUID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build.

inputs.name: p12
inputs.label: P12 certificate file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to a PKCS12-formatted P12 certificate file containing a signing certificate to be used for this build.

inputs.name: p12pwd
inputs.label: P12 password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to the P12 certificate file, if specified. Use a build variable to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: provProfile
inputs.label: Provisioning profile file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to a file containing the provisioning profile override to be used for this build.

inputs.name: removeProfile
inputs.label: Remove profile after build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies that the contents of the provisioning profile file should be removed from the build agent after the build is complete. **Only enable this if you are running one agent per user.**

tasks.name: XamariniOS
tasks.description: Build an iOS app with Xamarin on macOS
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613729) or [see the Xamarin iOS documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/xamarin/ios/)
tasks.releaseNotes: iOS signing set up has been removed from the task. Use `Secure Files` with supporting tasks `Install Apple Certificate` and `Install Apple Provisioning Profile` to setup signing. Updated options to work better with `Visual Studio for Mac`.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root of the Xamarin.iOS solution to build. May contain wildcards.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Standard configurations are Ad-Hoc, AppStore, Debug, Release.

inputs.name: clean
inputs.label: Clean
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run a clean build (/t:clean) prior to the build.

inputs.name: packageApp
inputs.label: Create app package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether an IPA should be generated as a part of the build.

inputs.name: forSimulator
inputs.label: Build for iOS Simulator
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally build for the iOS Simulator instead of physical iOS devices.

inputs.name: runNugetRestore
inputs.label: Run NuGet restore
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally run `nuget restore` on the Xamarin iOS solution to install all referenced packages before build. The 'nuget' tool in the PATH of the build agent machine will be used. To use a different version of NuGet or set additional arguments, use the [NuGet Tool Installer](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=852538) task.

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional command line arguments that should be used to build.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory in which builds will run. When empty, the root of the repository is used.

inputs.name: buildToolLocation
inputs.label: Build tool path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the full path to MSBuild (the Visual Studio for Mac build tool). When empty, the default MSBuild path is used.

inputs.name: iosSigningIdentity
inputs.label: Signing identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally override the signing identity that will be used to sign the build. If nothing is entered, the setting in the project will be used.

inputs.name: provProfileUuid
inputs.label: Provisioning profile UUID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build.

tasks.name: PublishTestResults
tasks.description: Publish test results to Azure Pipelines
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: testRunner
inputs.label: Test Result Format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Format of test result files generated by your choice of test runner e.g. JUnit, VSTest, XUnit V2 and NUnit.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test Results Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all xml files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: mergeTestResults
inputs.label: Merge Test Results
inputs.helpMarkDown: To merge results from all test results files to one test run in Azure Pipelines, check this option. To create a test run for each test results file, uncheck this option.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test Run Title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the Test Run.

inputs.name: platform
inputs.label: Platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Platform for which the tests were run.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configuration for which the tests were run.

inputs.name: publishRunAttachments
inputs.label: Upload Test Attachments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Opt in/out of publishing test run level attachments.

tasks.name: PublishTestResults
tasks.description: Publish test results to Azure Pipelines
tasks.releaseNotes:
• NUnit3 support
  • Support for Minimatch files pattern
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: testRunner
inputs.label: Test result format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Format of test result files generated by your choice of test runner e.g. JUnit, VSTest, XUnit V2, NUnit and CTest.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns. [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=835764)

inputs.name: searchFolder
inputs.label: Search folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder to search for the test result files. Defaults to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: mergeTestResults
inputs.label: Merge test results
inputs.helpMarkDown: A test run is created for each results file. Check this option to merge results into a single test run. To optimize for better performance, results will be merged into a single run if there are more than 100 result files, irrespective of this option.

inputs.name: failTaskOnFailedTests
inputs.label: Fail if there are test failures
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the task if there are any test failures. Check this option to fail the task if test failures are detected in the result files.

inputs.name: failTaskOnFailureToPublishResults
inputs.label: Fail if there is failure in publishing test results
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail if there is failure in publishing test results. Check this option to fail the task if publishing test results is failed partially.

inputs.name: failTaskOnMissingResultsFile
inputs.label: Fail if no result files are found
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the task if no result files are found.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the Test Run.

inputs.name: platform
inputs.label: Build Platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: Platform for which the tests were run.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Build Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configuration for which the tests were run.

inputs.name: publishRunAttachments
inputs.label: Upload test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upload logs and other files containing diagnostic information collected when the tests were run.

tasks.name: SonarQubePublish
tasks.description: Publish SonarQube's Quality Gate result on the Azure DevOps build result, to be used after the actual analysis.
tasks.author: sonarsource

inputs.name: pollingTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: This task will poll SonarQube until the analysis is completed, or until the timeout is reached. It also add a build property with the quality gate status of the current build(s) analyses.

tasks.name: SonarQubePublish
tasks.description: Publish SonarQube's Quality Gate result on the Azure DevOps build result, to be used after the actual analysis.
tasks.author: sonarsource

inputs.name: pollingTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: This task will poll SonarQube until the analysis is completed, or until the timeout is reached. It also add a build property with the quality gate status of the current build(s) analyses.

tasks.name: SonarQubePublish
tasks.description: Publish SonarQube's Quality Gate result on the Azure DevOps build result, to be used after the actual analysis.
tasks.author: sonarsource

inputs.name: pollingTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: This task will poll SonarQube until the analysis is completed, or until the timeout is reached. It also add a build property with the quality gate status of the current build(s) analyses.

tasks.name: SonarQubePublish
tasks.description: Publish SonarQube Server's Quality Gate result on the Azure DevOps build result, to be used after the actual analysis.
tasks.author: sonarsource

inputs.name: pollingTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: This task will poll SonarQube Server until the analysis is completed, or until the timeout is reached. It also add a build property with the quality gate status of the current build(s) analyses.

outputVariables.name: StorageContainerUri
outputVariables.description: Uri of the container where the files were copied to. Valid only when the selected destination is Azure Blob.

tasks.name: AzureFileCopy
tasks.description: Copy files to Azure Blob Storage or virtual machines
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://aka.ms/azurefilecopyreadme) and to report any issues with this new version of the task [here](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/new?assignees=&labels=regression%2Cbug&projects=&template=1.regression.yml&title=%5BREGRESSION%5D%3A+)
tasks.releaseNotes:
What's new in Version 6.0:
   Support Workload identity federation and [Azure RBAC](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/assign-azure-role-data-access?tabs=portal), also use [AzCopy.exe](https://github.com/Azure/azure-storage-azcopy/tree/v10.25.1) with version 10.25.1, for more info:[here](https://github.com/Azure/azure-storage-azcopy/releases)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: SourcePath
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path of the source folder, or file on the local machine, or a UNC share. Expression should return a single folder or a file. Wild card symbol (*) is supported anywhere in the file path or file name.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to target for copying the files.

inputs.name: Destination
inputs.label: Destination Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the destination, either Azure Blob or Azure VMs.

inputs.name: StorageAccountRM
inputs.label: RM Storage Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a pre-existing ARM storage account. It is also used as an intermediary for copying files to Azure VMs

inputs.name: ContainerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of the Container for uploading the files. If a container with the given name does not exist in the specified storage account, it will automatically be created.
If you need to create a virtual directory inside the container, use the blob prefix input below.
Example: If your target location is https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/vd1/vd2/, then specify mycontainer as container name and vd1/vd2/ as blob prefix.

inputs.name: BlobPrefix
inputs.label: Blob Prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: Useful for filtering files, for example, append build number to all the blobs to download files from that build only. Example: If you specify blob prefix as myvd1/, a virtual directory with this name will be created inside the container. Blob prefix with a trailing '/' will be considered a virtual directory. Otherwise, it will be treated as a file, unless the item being copied is itself a folder. The source files will be copied to https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myvd1/.

inputs.name: EnvironmentNameRM
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the target Resource Group for copying files to.

inputs.name: ResourceFilteringMethod
inputs.label: Select Machines By
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally, select a subset of VMs in resource group either by providing VMs host name or tags. [Tags](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/tag-template/) are supported for resources created via the Azure Resource Manager only.

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Filter Criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a list of VMs host name like ffweb, ffdb, or tags like Role:DB, Web; OS:Win8.1. Note the delimiters used for tags are ,(comma), :(colon) and ;(semicolon). If multiple tags are provided, then the task will run in all the VMs with the specified tags. The default is to run the task in all the VMs.

inputs.name: vmsAdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator Username of the VMs.

inputs.name: vmsAdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The administrator password of the VMs.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local path on the target machines for copying the files from the source. Environment variable can be used like $env:windir\BudgetIT\Web.

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForBlobCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for uploading files to blob)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when uploading to blob like, --check-length=true. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
--log-level=INFO (if the pipeline is running in debug mode set --log-level=DEBUG),
--recursive (only if container name is not $root),
--blob-type=PageBlob (only if specified storage account is a premium account).

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForVMCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for downloading files to VM)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when downloading to VM like, --check-length=true. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
--log-level=INFO (if the pipeline is running in debug mode set --log-level=DEBUG),
--recursive

inputs.name: enableCopyPrerequisites
inputs.label: Enable Copy Prerequisites
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing copy operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986). Applicable only for ARM VMs.

inputs.name: CopyFilesInParallel
inputs.label: Copy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will copy files in parallel to the target machines.

inputs.name: CleanTargetBeforeCopy
inputs.label: Clean Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will clean-up the destination folder before copying the files.

inputs.name: skipCACheck
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, client skips the validation that the server certificate is signed by a trusted certificate authority (CA) when connecting over Hypertext Transfer Protocol over Secure Socket Layer (HTTPS).

outputVariables.name: StorageContainerUri
outputVariables.description: Uri of the container where the files were copied to. Valid only when the selected destination is Azure Blob.

outputVariables.name: StorageContainerSasToken
outputVariables.description: SasToken for the container where the files were copied to. Valid only when the selected destination is Azure Blob.

tasks.name: AzureFileCopy

tasks.releaseNotes:
What's new in Version 4.0:
   Support AzCopy.exe version 10.8.0
