inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForBlobCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for uploading files to blob)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when uploading to blob like, --check-length=true. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
--log-level=INFO (if the pipeline is running in debug mode set --log-level=DEBUG),
--recursive (only if container name is not $root),
--blob-type=PageBlob (only if specified storage account is a premium account).

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForVMCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for downloading files to VM)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when downloading to VM like, --check-length=true. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
--log-level=INFO (if the pipeline is running in debug mode set --log-level=DEBUG),
--recursive

inputs.name: sasTokenTimeOutInMinutes
inputs.label: SAS Token Expiration Period In Minutes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the time in minutes after which SAS token for the container will expire. By default, this token expires after 4 hours.

inputs.name: enableCopyPrerequisites
inputs.label: Enable Copy Prerequisites
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing copy operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986). Applicable only for ARM VMs.

inputs.name: CopyFilesInParallel
inputs.label: Copy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will copy files in parallel to the target machines.

inputs.name: CleanTargetBeforeCopy
inputs.label: Clean Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will clean-up the destination folder before copying the files.

inputs.name: skipCACheck
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, client skips the validation that the server certificate is signed by a trusted certificate authority (CA) when connecting over Hypertext Transfer Protocol over Secure Socket Layer (HTTPS).

outputVariables.name: StorageContainerUri
outputVariables.description: Uri of the container where the files were copied to. Valid only when the selected destination is Azure Blob.

outputVariables.name: StorageContainerSasToken
outputVariables.description: SasToken for the container where the files were copied to. Valid only when the selected destination is Azure Blob.

tasks.name: AzureFileCopy
tasks.description: Copy files to Azure Blob Storage or virtual machines
tasks.releaseNotes:
What's new in Version 5.0:
   Support AzCopy.exe version 10.12.2
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: SourcePath
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path of the source folder, or file on the local machine, or a UNC share. Expression should return a single folder or a file. Wild card symbol (*) is supported anywhere in the file path or file name.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to target for copying the files.

inputs.name: Destination
inputs.label: Destination Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the destination, either Azure Blob or Azure VMs.

inputs.name: StorageAccountRM
inputs.label: RM Storage Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a pre-existing ARM storage account. It is also used as an intermediary for copying files to Azure VMs

inputs.name: ContainerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of the Container for uploading the files. If a container with the given name does not exist in the specified storage account, it will automatically be created.
If you need to create a virtual directory inside the container, use the blob prefix input below.
Example: If your target location is https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/vd1/vd2/, then specify mycontainer as container name and vd1/vd2/ as blob prefix.

inputs.name: BlobPrefix
inputs.label: Blob Prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: Useful for filtering files, for example, append build number to all the blobs to download files from that build only. Example: If you specify blob prefix as myvd1/, a virtual directory with this name will be created inside the container. Blob prefix with a trailing '/' will be considered a virtual directory. Otherwise, it will be treated as a file, unless the item being copied is itself a folder. The source files will be copied to https://myaccount.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/myvd1/.

inputs.name: EnvironmentNameRM
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the target Resource Group for copying files to.

inputs.name: ResourceFilteringMethod
inputs.label: Select Machines By
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally, select a subset of VMs in resource group either by providing VMs host name or tags. [Tags](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/tag-template/) are supported for resources created via the Azure Resource Manager only.

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Filter Criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a list of VMs host name like ffweb, ffdb, or tags like Role:DB, Web; OS:Win8.1. Note the delimiters used for tags are ,(comma), :(colon) and ;(semicolon). If multiple tags are provided, then the task will run in all the VMs with the specified tags. The default is to run the task in all the VMs.

inputs.name: vmsAdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator Username of the VMs.

inputs.name: vmsAdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The administrator password of the VMs.
It can accept variable defined in build or release pipelines as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local path on the target machines for copying the files from the source. Environment variable can be used like $env:windir\BudgetIT\Web.

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForBlobCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for uploading files to blob)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when uploading to blob like, --check-length=true. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
--log-level=INFO (if the pipeline is running in debug mode set --log-level=DEBUG),
--recursive (only if container name is not $root),
--blob-type=PageBlob (only if specified storage account is a premium account).

inputs.name: AdditionalArgumentsForVMCopy
inputs.label: Optional Arguments (for downloading files to VM)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optional AzCopy.exe arguments that will be applied when downloading to VM like, --check-length=true. If no optional arguments are specified here, the following optional arguments will be added by default.
--log-level=INFO (if the pipeline is running in debug mode set --log-level=DEBUG),
--recursive

inputs.name: sasTokenTimeOutInMinutes
inputs.label: SAS Token Expiration Period In Minutes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the time in minutes after which SAS token for the container will expire. By default, this token expires after 4 hours.

inputs.name: enableCopyPrerequisites
inputs.label: Enable Copy Prerequisites
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing copy operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986). Applicable only for ARM VMs.

inputs.name: CopyFilesInParallel
inputs.label: Copy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will copy files in parallel to the target machines.

inputs.name: CleanTargetBeforeCopy
inputs.label: Clean Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will clean-up the destination folder before copying the files.

inputs.name: skipCACheck
inputs.label: Test Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, client skips the validation that the server certificate is signed by a trusted certificate authority (CA) when connecting over Hypertext Transfer Protocol over Secure Socket Layer (HTTPS).

tasks.name: PublishSymbols
tasks.description: Index your source code and publish symbols to a file share or Azure Artifacts symbol server
tasks.helpMarkDown: See [more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613722) on how to use this task.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Resource Manager connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Azure Resource Manager service connection. Supported authentication type is currently only workload identity federation.

inputs.name: SymbolsFolder
inputs.label: Path to symbols folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the folder that is searched for symbol files.  The default is $(Build.SourcesDirectory).  Otherwise specify a rooted path, for example: $(Build.BinariesDirectory)/MyProject

inputs.name: SearchPattern
inputs.label: Search pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pattern used to discover the pdb files to publish.

inputs.name: Manifest
inputs.label: Manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to a file containing more symbol client keys to publish.

inputs.name: IndexSources
inputs.label: Index sources
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to inject source server information into the PDB files. This option is only supported on Windows agents.

inputs.name: PublishSymbols
inputs.label: Publish symbols
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to publish the symbol files.

options.TeamServices: Symbol Server in this organization/collection (requires Azure Artifacts)

inputs.name: SymbolServerType
inputs.label: Symbol server type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose where to publish symbols. Symbols published to the Azure Artifacts symbol server are accessible by any user with access to the organization/collection. Azure DevOps Server only supports the "File share" option. Follow [these instructions](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=846265) to use Symbol Server in Azure Artifacts.

inputs.name: SymbolsPath
inputs.label: Path to publish symbols
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file share that hosts your symbols. This value will be used in the call to `symstore.exe add` as the `/s` parameter.

inputs.name: CompressSymbols
inputs.label: Compress symbols
inputs.helpMarkDown: Compress symbols when publishing to file share.

inputs.name: SymbolExpirationInDays
inputs.label: Symbol Expiration (in days)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The number of days that symbols should be retained.

options.Default: The Default set of symbols to upload
options.Pdb: Only Pdb based symbols Windows pdb's and managed Portable pdb's.

inputs.name: IndexableFileFormats
inputs.label: Symbol file formats to publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: Which debug formats to publish to the symbol server

inputs.name: DetailedLog
inputs.label: Verbose logging
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use verbose logging.

inputs.name: TreatNotIndexedAsWarning
inputs.label: Warn if not indexed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to warn if sources are not indexed for a PDB file. Otherwise the messages are logged as normal output.

inputs.name: UseNetCoreClientTool
inputs.label: Use NetCore client tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to use version of the symbol upload tool that supports DWARF and ELF files. This option only matters on Windows agents. On non-Windows agents, the version of the symbol upload tool that supports DWARF and ELF files will always be used.

inputs.name: SymbolsMaximumWaitTime
inputs.label: Max wait time (min)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The number of minutes to wait before failing this task.

inputs.name: SymbolsProduct
inputs.label: Product
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the product parameter to symstore.exe.  The default is $(Build.DefinitionName)

inputs.name: SymbolsVersion
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the version parameter to symstore.exe.  The default is $(Build.BuildNumber)

inputs.name: SymbolsArtifactName
inputs.label: Artifact name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the artifact name to use for the Symbols artifact.  The default is Symbols_$(BuildConfiguration)

tasks.name: PublishSymbols
tasks.description: Index your source code and publish symbols to a file share
tasks.helpMarkDown:
Indexing enables you to use your .pdb symbol files to debug an app on a machine other than the one you used to build the app. For example, you can debug an app built by a build agent from a dev machine that does not have the source code.
[More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613722)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: SymbolsPath
inputs.label: Path to publish symbols
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to the symbol store share.  If this value is not set, source indexing will occur but symbols will not be published.

inputs.name: SearchPattern
inputs.label: Search pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pattern used to discover the pdb files to publish.

inputs.name: SymbolsFolder
inputs.label: Path to symbols folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the folder that is searched for symbol files.  The default is $(Build.SourcesDirectory).  Otherwise specify a rooted path, for example: $(Build.BinariesDirectory)/MyProject

inputs.name: SkipIndexing
inputs.label: Skip indexing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to skip injecting source server information into the PDB files.

inputs.name: TreatNotIndexedAsWarning
inputs.label: Warn if not indexed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to warn if sources are not indexed for a PDB file. Otherwise the messages are logged as normal output.

tasks.name: CopyFilesOverSSH
tasks.description: Copy files or build artifacts to a remote machine over SSH
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: sshEndpoint
inputs.label: SSH service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: SSH service connection with connection details for the remote machine.

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder of the files to copy to the remote machine.  When empty, the root of the repository (build) or artifacts directory (release) is used, which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).  Use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) if files are not in the repository. Example: $(Agent.BuildDirectory)

inputs.name: contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: File paths to include as part of the copy. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns. [More Information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=821894)

inputs.name: targetFolder
inputs.label: Target folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target folder on the remote machine to where files will be copied. Example: /home/user/MySite.

inputs.name: isWindowsOnTarget
inputs.label: Target machine running Windows
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target machine running Windows

inputs.name: cleanTargetFolder
inputs.label: Clean target folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete all existing files and subfolders in the target folder before copying.

inputs.name: cleanHiddenFilesInTarget
inputs.label: Remove hidden files in target folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Remove hidden files in the target folder.

inputs.name: readyTimeout
inputs.label: SSH handshake timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: How long (in milliseconds) to wait for the SSH handshake to complete.

validation.message: Enter a valid value for timeout.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace existing files in and beneath the target folder.

inputs.name: failOnEmptySource
inputs.label: Fail if no files found to copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail if no matching files to be copied are found under the source folder.

inputs.name: flattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder on the remote machine.

inputs.name: concurrentUploads
inputs.label: Number of concurrent uploads when copying files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of concurrent uploads when copying files. Default is 10.

inputs.name: delayBetweenUploads
inputs.label: Delay between queueing uploads (in milliseconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delay between queueing uploads (in milliseconds). Default is 50.

tasks.instanceNameFormat: Securely copy files to the remote machine

tasks.name: Gradle
tasks.description: Build using a Gradle wrapper script
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=613720) or [see the Gradle documentation](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/userguide.html)
tasks.releaseNotes: Configuration of the SonarQube analysis was moved to the [SonarQube](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarqube) or [SonarCloud](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarcloud) extensions, in task `Prepare Analysis Configuration`
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: wrapperScript
inputs.label: Gradle wrapper
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the Gradle Wrapper script.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory in which to run the Gradle build. If not specified, the repository root directory is used.

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.label: Publish to Azure Pipelines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit test results produced by the Gradle build to Azure Pipelines. Each test results file matching `Test Results Files` will be published as a test run in Azure Pipelines.

inputs.name: testResultsFiles
inputs.label: Test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test results files path. Wildcards can be used ([more information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=856077)). For example, `**/TEST-*.xml` for all XML files whose name starts with TEST-.

inputs.name: testRunTitle
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.

inputs.name: codeCoverageTool
inputs.label: Code coverage tool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the code coverage tool.

inputs.name: classFilesDirectories
inputs.label: Class files directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of directories containing class files and archive files (JAR, WAR, etc.). Code coverage is reported for class files in these directories. Normally, classes under `build/classes/java/main` (for Gradle 4+) are searched, which is the default class directory for Gradle builds

inputs.name: classFilter
inputs.label: Class inclusion/exclusion filters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of filters to include or exclude classes from collecting code coverage. For example: +:com.*,+:org.*,-:my.app*.*.

inputs.name: failIfCoverageEmpty
inputs.label: Fail when code coverage results are missing
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if code coverage did not produce any results to publish.

inputs.name: gradle5xOrHigher
inputs.label: Gradle version >= 5.x
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this to 'true' if gradle version is >= 5.x.'True' by default.

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Set JAVA_HOME by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path.

inputs.name: jdkVersion
inputs.label: JDK version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will attempt to discover the path to the selected JDK version and set JAVA_HOME accordingly.

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: JDK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path.

inputs.name: jdkArchitecture
inputs.label: JDK architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the architecture (x86, x64) of the JDK.

inputs.name: gradleOpts
inputs.label: Set GRADLE_OPTS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets the GRADLE_OPTS environment variable, which is used to send command-line arguments to start the JVM. The xmx flag specifies the maximum memory available to the JVM.

inputs.name: sqAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run SonarQube or SonarCloud Analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option has changed from version 1 of the **Gradle** task to use the [SonarQube](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarqube) and [SonarCloud](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SonarSource.sonarcloud) marketplace extensions. Enable this option to run [SonarQube or SonarCloud analysis](http://redirect.sonarsource.com/doc/install-configure-scanner-tfs-ts.html) after executing tasks in the **Tasks** field. You must also add a **Prepare Analysis Configuration** task from one of the extensions to the build pipeline before this Gradle task.

options.build: Use plugin applied in your build.gradle

inputs.name: sqGradlePluginVersionChoice
inputs.label: SonarQube scanner for Gradle version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube Gradle plugin version to use. You can declare it in your Gradle configuration file, or specify a version here.

inputs.name: sqGradlePluginVersion
inputs.label: SonarQube scanner for Gradle plugin version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Refer to https://plugins.gradle.org/plugin/org.sonarqube for all available versions.

inputs.name: checkstyleAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run Checkstyle
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the Checkstyle tool with the default Sun checks. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: findbugsAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run FindBugs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the FindBugs static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts. In Gradle 6.0 this plugin was removed. Use spotbugs plugin instead. [More info](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/upgrading_version_5.html#the_findbugs_plugin_has_been_removed)

inputs.name: pmdAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run PMD
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the PMD Java static analysis tool to look for bugs in the code. Results are uploaded as build artifacts.

inputs.name: spotBugsAnalysisEnabled
inputs.label: Run SpotBugs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable this option to run spotBugs. This plugin works with Gradle v5.6 or later. [More info](https://spotbugs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/gradle.html#use-spotbugs-gradle-plugin)

options.build: Use plugin applied in your build.gradle

inputs.name: spotBugsGradlePluginVersionChoice
inputs.label: Spotbugs plugin version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Spotbugs Gradle plugin version to use. You can declare it in your Gradle configuration file, or specify a version here.

inputs.name: spotbugsGradlePluginVersion
inputs.label: Version number
inputs.helpMarkDown: Refer to https://plugins.gradle.org/plugin/com.github.spotbugs for all available versions.

tasks.name: AzureTestPlan
tasks.description: Run manual and automated tests points of test plan for different Development frameworks like Maven and Gradle for Java, PyTest for Python and Jest for JavaScript
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Resource Manager connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Manager service connection

inputs.name: testSelector
inputs.label: Test cases to be executed
inputs.helpMarkDown:
• Manual tests: Use this option to trigger manual tests from your test plan.
  • Automated tests: Use this option to run tests from your test plan that have automated test method associated with it.

inputs.name: testPlanOrRunSelector
inputs.label: Select tests using
inputs.helpMarkDown:
• Test assembly: Use this option to specify one or more test assemblies that contain your tests. You can optionally specify a filter criteria to select only specific tests.
  • Test plan: Use this option to run tests from your test plan that have an automated test method associated with it.
  • Test run: Use this option when you are setting up an environment to run tests from the Test hub. This option should not be used when running tests in a continuous integration / continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline.

inputs.name: testRunId
inputs.label: Test Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test run based selection is used when triggering automated test runs from the test hub, value for this should be kept as it is

inputs.name: testPlan

inputs.helpMarkDown: Type or paste the test plan ID containing test suites with test cases.

inputs.name: testSuite
inputs.label: Test suite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select one or more test suites containing test cases.

inputs.name: testConfiguration
inputs.label: Test configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select Test Configuration.

inputs.name: testLanguageInput
inputs.label: Select Test framework language
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test Framework Language of automated tests in test plan

inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the Maven POM file.

inputs.name: gradleFilePath
inputs.label: Gradle file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repository root to the build.gradle file.

inputs.name: publishRunAttachments
inputs.label: Upload test results files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upload logs and other files containing diagnostic information collected when the tests were run.

inputs.name: failTaskOnFailedTests
inputs.label: Fail if there are test failures
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the task if there are any test failures. Check this option to fail the task if test failures are detected in the result files.

inputs.name: failTaskOnFailureToPublishResults
inputs.label: Fail if there is failure in publishing test results
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail if there is failure in publishing test results. Check this option to fail the task if publishing test results is failed partially.

inputs.name: failTaskOnMissingResultsFile
inputs.label: Fail if no result files are found
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the task if no result files are found.

tasks.name: NuGetToolInstaller
tasks.description: Acquires a specific version of NuGet from the internet or the tools cache and adds it to the PATH. Use this task to change the version of NuGet used in the NuGet tasks.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version of NuGet.exe to install
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A version or version range that specifies the NuGet version to make available on the path. Use x as a wildcard. See the [list of available NuGet versions](http://dist.nuget.org/tools.json).

If you want to match a pre-release version, the specification must contain a major, minor, patch, and pre-release version from the list above.

Examples: 4.x, 3.3.x, 2.8.6, >=4.0.0-0

inputs.name: checkLatest
inputs.label: Always download the latest matching version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Always check for and download the latest available version of NuGet.exe which satisfies the version spec. This option will also always incur download time, even if the selected version of NuGet is already cached.

Enabling this option could cause unexpected build breaks when a new version of NuGet is released.

tasks.name: NuGetToolInstaller
tasks.description: Acquires a specific version of NuGet from the internet or the tools cache and adds it to the PATH. Use this task to change the version of NuGet used in the NuGet tasks.
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=852538) or [see the NuGet documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version of NuGet.exe to install
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A version or version range that specifies the NuGet version to make available on the path. Use x as a wildcard. See the [list of available NuGet versions](http://dist.nuget.org/tools.json).

If you want to match a pre-release version, the specification must contain a major, minor, patch, and pre-release version from the list above.

Examples: 4.x, 3.3.x, 2.8.6, >=4.0.0-0

If unspecified, a version will be chosen automatically.

inputs.name: checkLatest
inputs.label: Always check for new versions
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Always check for and download the latest available version of NuGet.exe which satisfies the version spec.

Enabling this option could cause unexpected build breaks when a new version of NuGet is released.

tasks.name: JenkinsDownloadArtifacts
tasks.description: Download artifacts produced by a Jenkins job
tasks.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by a [Jenkins](https://jenkins.io/) job.
tasks.author: Microsoft

inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: Jenkins service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service connection for your Jenkins instance. To create one, click the Manage link and create a new Jenkins service connection.

inputs.name: jobName
inputs.label: Job name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Jenkins job to download artifacts from.  This must exactly match the job name on the Jenkins server.

inputs.name: jenkinsJobType
inputs.label: Jenkins job type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Jenkins job type, detected automatically.

inputs.name: saveTo
inputs.label: Save to
inputs.helpMarkDown: Jenkins artifacts will be downloaded and saved to this directory.  This directory will be created if it does not exist.

inputs.name: jenkinsBuild
inputs.label: Download artifacts produced by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by the last successful build, or from a specific build instance.

inputs.name: jenkinsBuildNumber
inputs.label: Jenkins build number
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by this build.

inputs.name: itemPattern
inputs.label: Item Pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify files to be downloaded as multi line minimatch pattern. [More Information](https://aka.ms/minimatchexamples)

The default pattern (\*\*) will download all files across all artifacts produced by the Jenkins job. To download all files within artifact drop use drop/**.

inputs.name: downloadCommitsAndWorkItems
inputs.label: Download Commits and WorkItems
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enables downloading the commits and work item details associated with the Jenkins Job

inputs.name: startJenkinsBuildNumber
inputs.label: Download commits and work items from
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional start build number for downloading commits and work items. If provided, all commits and work items between start build number and build number given as input to download artifacts will be downloaded.

inputs.name: artifactDetailsFileNameSuffix
inputs.label: Commit and WorkItem FileName
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional file name suffix for commits and work item attachments. Attachments will be created with commits_{suffix}.json and workitem_{suffix}.json. If this input is not provided, attachments will be created with the name commits.json and workitems.json

inputs.name: propagatedArtifacts
inputs.label: Artifacts are propagated to Azure
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this if Jenkins artifacts were propagated to Azure. To upload Jenkins artifacts to azure, refer to this [Jenkins plugin](https://wiki.jenkins.io/display/JENKINS/Windows+Azure+Storage+Plugin)

inputs.name: artifactProvider
inputs.label: Artifact Provider
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the external storage provider used in Jenkins job to upload the artifacts.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the artifacts.

inputs.name: storageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic and Resource Manager stoarge accounts are listed. Select the Storage account name in which the artifacts are propagated.

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container in the storage account to which artifacts are uploaded.

inputs.name: commonVirtualPath
inputs.label: Common Virtual Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the artifacts inside the Azure storage container.

tasks.name: AzureFunctionAppContainer
tasks.description: Update a function app with a Docker container
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: azureSubscription
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: App name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select the name of an existing Azure App Service. App services based on selected app type will only be listed.

inputs.name: deployToSlotOrASE
inputs.label: Deploy to Slot or App Service Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the option to deploy to an existing deployment slot or Azure App Service Environment.
For both the targets, the task needs Resource group name.
In case the deployment target is a slot, by default the deployment is done to the production slot. Any other existing slot name can also be provided.
In case the deployment target is an Azure App Service environment, leave the slot name as ‘production’ and just specify the Resource group name.

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The Resource group name is required when the deployment target is either a deployment slot or an App Service Environment.
Enter or Select the Azure Resource group that contains the Azure App Service specified above.

inputs.name: slotName
inputs.label: Slot
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or Select an existing Slot other than the Production slot.

inputs.name: imageName
inputs.label: Image name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A globally unique top-level domain name for your specific registry or namespace.
Note: Fully qualified image name will be of the format: '`/`:`'. For example, 'myregistry.azurecr.io/nginx:latest'.

inputs.name: containerCommand
inputs.label: Startup command
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter the start up command. For ex.
dotnet exec filename.dll
dotnet filename.dll

inputs.name: appSettings
inputs.label: App settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app application settings following the syntax -key value . Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -Port 5000 -RequestTimeout 5000
-WEBSITE_TIME_ZONE "Eastern Standard Time"

inputs.name: configurationStrings
inputs.label: Configuration settings
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Edit web app configuration settings following the syntax -key value. Value containing spaces should be enclosed in double quotes.
Example : -phpVersion 5.6 -linuxFxVersion: node|6.11

tasks.instanceNameFormat: Azure Function App on Container Deploy: $(appName)

tasks.name: DecryptFile
tasks.description: Decrypt a file using OpenSSL
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: cipher
inputs.label: Cypher
inputs.helpMarkDown: Encryption cypher to use. See [cypher suite names](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627129) for a complete list of possible values.

inputs.name: inFile
inputs.label: Encrypted file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path of file to decrypt.

inputs.name: passphrase
inputs.label: Passphrase
inputs.helpMarkDown: Passphrase to use for decryption. **Use a Variable to encrypt the passphrase.**

inputs.name: outFile
inputs.label: Decrypted file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional filename for decrypted file. Defaults to the Encrypted File with a ".out" extension

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for decryption. Defaults to the root of the repository.

outputVariables.description: Exit code emitted from the execution of specified Helm command

tasks.name: HelmDeploy

tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: cluster
groups.visibleRule: command != logout && command != package && command != save

groups.name: tls
groups.visibleRule: command != login && command != logout && command != package && command != save

groups.visibleRule: command != login && command != logout && command != package && command != save

inputs.name: connectionType
inputs.label: Connection Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select 'Azure Resource Manager' to connect to an Azure Kubernetes Service by using Azure Service Connection. Select 'Kubernetes Service Connection' to connect to any Kubernetes cluster by using kubeconfig or Service Account

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription, which has your Azure Container Registry.

inputs.name: azureResourceGroup
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Group.

inputs.name: kubernetesCluster
inputs.label: Kubernetes cluster
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Managed Cluster.

inputs.name: useClusterAdmin
inputs.label: Use cluster admin credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use cluster administrator credentials instead of default cluster user credentials.

inputs.name: kubernetesServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Kubernetes Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Kubernetes service connection.

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.label: Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify K8 namespace to use. Use Tiller namespace can be specified in the advanced section of the task or by passing the --tiller-namespace option as argument.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpointForACR
inputs.label: Azure subscription for Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription, which has your Azure Container Registry.

inputs.name: azureResourceGroupForACR
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Group, which has your Container Registry.

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry which will be used for pushing helm charts.

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a helm command.

inputs.name: chartType
inputs.label: Chart Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select how you want to enter chart info. You can either provide name of the chart or folder/file path to the chart.

inputs.name: chartName
inputs.label: Chart Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Chart reference to install, this can be a url or a chart name. For example, if chart name is 'stable/mysql', the task will run 'helm install stable/mysql'.

inputs.name: chartPath
inputs.label: Chart Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the chart to install. This can be a path to a packaged chart or a path to an unpacked chart directory. For example, if './redis' is specified the task will run 'helm install ./redis'.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the exact chart version to install. If this is not specified, the latest version is installed. Set the version on the chart to this semver version​
inputs.visibleRule: command == package || command == install || command == upgrade

inputs.name: releaseName
inputs.label: Release Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Release name. If unspecified, it will autogenerate one for you.

inputs.name: overrideValues
inputs.label: Set Values
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas or newlines: key1=val1,key2=val2 or
key1=val1
key2=val2
). The task will construct the helm command by using these set values. For example, helm install --set key1=val1 ./redis.

inputs.name: valueFile
inputs.label: Value File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify values in a YAML file or a URL. For example, specifying myvalues.yaml will result in 'helm install --values=myvals.yaml'.

inputs.name: destination
inputs.label: Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify values in a YAML file or a URL.

inputs.name: canaryimage
inputs.label: Use canary image version.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the canary Tiller image, the latest pre-release version of Tiller.

inputs.name: upgradetiller
inputs.label: Upgrade Tiller
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upgrade if Tiller is already installed.

inputs.name: updatedependency
inputs.label: Update Dependency
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run helm dependency update before installing the chart. Update dependencies from 'requirements.yaml' to dir 'charts/' before packaging

inputs.name: save
inputs.label: Save
inputs.helpMarkDown: Save packaged chart to local chart repository (default true)​

inputs.name: install
inputs.label: Install if release not present.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If a release by this name doesn't already exist, run an install​.

inputs.name: recreate
inputs.label: Recreate Pods.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Performs pods restart for the resource if applicable.

inputs.name: resetValues
inputs.label: Reset Values.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Reset the values to the ones built into the chart.

inputs.name: force
inputs.label: Force
inputs.helpMarkDown: Force resource update through delete/recreate if needed​

inputs.name: waitForExecution
inputs.label: Wait
inputs.helpMarkDown: Block till command execution completes.
inputs.visibleRule: command == init || command == install || command == upgrade

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Helm command options.

inputs.label: Enable TLS

inputs.name: caCert

inputs.helpMarkDown: CA cert used to issue certificate for tiller and helm client.

inputs.name: certificate
inputs.label: Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify Tiller certificate or Helm client certificate

inputs.name: privatekey
inputs.label: Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify Tiller Key or Helm client key

inputs.name: tillernamespace
inputs.label: Tiller namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify K8 namespace of tiller.

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely on the exit code to determine failure.

inputs.name: publishPipelineMetadata
inputs.label: Publish pipeline metadata

inputs.helpMarkDown: Chart name with which the chart will be stored in Azure Container Registry.

inputs.name: chartPathForACR
inputs.label: Chart Path for Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the chart directory.

tasks.name: InstallAppleCertificate
tasks.description: Install an Apple certificate required to build on a macOS agent machine
tasks.releaseNotes: Fixes codesign hangs on a self hosted agent. A Keychain password is now required to use `Default Keychain` or `Custom Keychain`. Microsoft hosted builds should use `Temporary Keychain`.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: certSecureFile
inputs.label: Certificate (P12)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the certificate (.p12) that was uploaded to `Secure Files` to install on the macOS agent.

inputs.name: certPwd
inputs.label: Certificate (P12) password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to the Apple certificate (.p12). Use a new build variable with its lock enabled on the `Variables` tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: keychain
inputs.label: Keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the keychain in which to install the Apple certificate. For Microsoft hosted builds, use `Temporary Keychain`. A temporary keychain will always be deleted after the build or release is complete.

inputs.name: keychainPassword
inputs.label: Keychain password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to unlock the keychain. Use a new build variable with its lock enabled on the `Variables` tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: customKeychainPath
inputs.label: Custom keychain path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to a custom keychain file. The keychain will be created if it does not exist.

inputs.name: deleteCert
inputs.label: Delete certificate from keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to delete the certificate from the keychain after the build or release is complete.

inputs.name: deleteCustomKeychain
inputs.label: Delete custom keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to delete the custom keychain from the agent after the build or release is complete.

inputs.name: signingIdentity
inputs.label: Certificate signing identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Common Name of the subject in the signing certificate.  Will attempt to parse the Common Name if this is left empty.

inputs.name: setUpPartitionIdACLForPrivateKey
inputs.label: Set up partition_id ACL for the imported private key
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true - sets the partition_id ACL for the imported private key, so codesign won't prompt to use the key for signing. This isn't necessary for temporary keychains, at least on MacOS High Sierra. See the [link](http://www.openradar.me/28524119) for more details.

inputs.name: opensslPkcsArgs
inputs.label: OpenSSL arguments for PKCS12
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments for extraction certificate information using openssl.

outputVariables.name: signingIdentity
outputVariables.description: The resolved Common Name of the subject in the signing certificate. Either supplied as an input or parsed from the P12 certificate file.

outputVariables.name: keychainPath
outputVariables.description: The path for the keychain file with the certificate.

inputs.label: Custom Keychain Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to a custom keychain file. The keychain will be created if it does not exist.

inputs.name: deleteCert
inputs.label: Delete Certificate from Keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to delete the certificate from the keychain after the build or release is complete.

inputs.name: deleteCustomKeychain
inputs.label: Delete Custom Keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select to delete the custom keychain from the agent after the build or release is complete.

inputs.name: signingIdentity
inputs.label: Certificate Signing Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Common Name of the subject in the signing certificate.  Will attempt to parse the Common Name if this is left empty.

tasks.name: AzureFunction
tasks.description: Invoke an Azure Function
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: function
inputs.label: Azure function URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: URL of the Azure function that needs to be invoked​. Example:- https://azurefunctionapp.azurewebsites.net/api/HttpTriggerJS1

inputs.name: key
inputs.label: Function key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Function or Host key with which to access this function. To keep the key secure, define a secret variable and use it here. Example: - $(myFunctionKey) where myFunctionKey is a secret pipeline variable with a value of the secret key, like `ZxPXnIEODXLRzYwCw1TgZ4osMfoKs9Zn6se6X/N0FnztfDvZbdOmYw==`

inputs.name: method
inputs.label: Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the HTTP method with which the function should be invoked.

inputs.name: headers
inputs.label: Headers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define a header in JSON format. The header shall be attached to the request that is sent.

inputs.name: queryParameters
inputs.label: Query parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Query parameters string to append to the function URL. It should not start with with "?" nor "&".

inputs.name: body
inputs.label: Body
inputs.helpMarkDown: JSON-formatted message body for the request.

inputs.name: waitForCompletion
inputs.label: Completion event
inputs.helpMarkDown: Default value "ApiResponse". Available values: "ApiResponse", "Callback" call where the Azure function calls back to update the timeline record​.

inputs.name: successCriteria
inputs.label: Success criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Criteria which defines when to pass the task. No criteria means the response content does not influence the result. Example:- For response {"status" : "successful"}, the expression can be eq(root['status'], 'successful'). [More information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=842996)​

tasks.name: SSH
tasks.description: Run shell commands or a script on a remote machine using SSH

inputs.name: sshEndpoint
inputs.label: SSH service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: SSH service connection with connection details for the remote machine.

inputs.name: runOptions
inputs.label: Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to either run shell commands or a shell script on the remote machine.

inputs.name: commands
inputs.label: Commands
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the shell commands to run on the remote machine. Enter each command along with its arguments on a new line. To run multiple commands together, enter them on the same line separated by semi-colons (e.g. cd /home/user/myFolder;build).

inputs.name: scriptPath
inputs.label: Shell script path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the shell script file to run on the remote machine.

inputs.name: inline
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Write the shell script to run on the remote machine.

inputs.name: interpreterCommand
inputs.label: Interpreter command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the command interpreter used to execute the script. Adds a shebang line to the beginning of the script. Relevant only for UNIX-like operating systems. Please use empty string for Windows-based remote hosts. [See more about shebang (#!)](https://homepages.cwi.nl/~aeb/std/shebang/unix-faq.txt)

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to pass to the shell script.

inputs.name: failOnStdErr
inputs.label: Fail on STDERR
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, the build will fail when the remote commands or script write to STDERR.

inputs.name: interactiveSession
inputs.label: Enable interactive session
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is selected, interactive session will be started - if there's a password request, it will be filled by user's password. It could be useful to run commands like 'sudo'

inputs.name: readyTimeout
inputs.label: SSH handshake timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: How long (in milliseconds) to wait for the SSH handshake to complete.

validation.message: Enter a valid value for timeout.

inputs.name: interactiveKeyboardAuthentication
inputs.label: Use interactive-keyboard authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this value if PasswordAuthentication is disabled on the target machine

inputs.name: targetPath

inputs.name: properties

tasks.name: PublishPipelineArtifact
tasks.description: Publish (upload) a file or directory as a named artifact for the current run
tasks.helpMarkDown: Publish (upload) a file or directory as a named artifact for the current run. Published artifacts can be downloaded in other jobs, stages, or pipelines using the "Download pipeline artifact" task.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: path
inputs.label: File or directory path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path of the file or directory to publish. Can be absolute or relative to the default working directory. Can include [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988), but wildcards are not supported.

inputs.name: artifactName
inputs.label: Artifact name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the artifact to publish. If not set, defaults to a unique ID scoped to the job.

inputs.name: artifactType
inputs.label: Artifact publish location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to store the artifact in Azure Pipelines, or to copy it to a file share that must be accessible from the pipeline agent.

inputs.name: fileSharePath
inputs.label: File share path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file share to which the artifact files will be copied. This can include variables. Example: \\\\my\\share\\$(Build.DefinitionName)\\$(Build.BuildNumber). Publishing artifacts from a Linux or macOS agent to a file share is not supported.

inputs.name: parallel
inputs.label: Parallel copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select whether to copy files in parallel using multiple threads for greater potential throughput. If this setting is not enabled, one thread will be used.

inputs.name: parallelCount
inputs.label: Parallel count
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the degree of parallelism, or number of threads used, to perform the copy. The value must be at least 1 and not greater than 128.

inputs.name: properties
inputs.label: Custom properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter custom properties to associate with the artifact. Valid JSON string expected with all keys having the prefix 'user-'

tasks.name: SonarQubePreBuild
tasks.description: [DEPRECATED] Fetch the Quality Profile from SonarQube to configure the analysis
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: projectKey
inputs.label: Project Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube project unique key, i.e. sonar.projectKey

inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube project name, i.e. sonar.projectName

inputs.name: projectVersion
inputs.label: Project Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube project version, i.e. sonar.projectVersion

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: SonarQube Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SonarQube server generic endpoint

inputs.name: dbUrl
inputs.label: Db Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only. The database connection setting, i.e. sonar.jdbc.url. For example jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://localhost/sonar;SelectMethod=Cursor

inputs.name: dbUsername
inputs.label: Db UserName
inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only The username for the database user, i.e. sonar.jdbc.username.

inputs.name: dbPassword
inputs.label: Db User Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: SonarQube server 5.1 and lower only. The password for the database user, i.e. sonar.jdbc.password

inputs.name: cmdLineArgs
inputs.label: Additional Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Space separated settings using the format: /d:propertyName=propertyValue. Normal command line escaping rules apply. For more details on the settings please view the [SonarQube docs](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=624390).

inputs.name: configFile
inputs.label: Settings File
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can also specify settings via a configuration file. A template is available [here](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=620062)

inputs.name: includeFullReport
inputs.label: Include full analysis report in the build summary (SQ 5.3+)
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option will delay the build until the SonarQube analysis is completed.

inputs.name: breakBuild
inputs.label: Fail the build on quality gate failure (SQ 5.3+)
inputs.helpMarkDown: This option is only available when using a SonarQube server 5.3 or above. It will introduce delays as the build must wait for SonarQube to complete the analysis. [More information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=722407)

tasks.name: Kubernetes
tasks.description: Deploy, configure, update a Kubernetes cluster in Azure Container Service by running kubectl commands
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851275) or [see the Kubernetes documentation](https://kubernetes.io/docs/home/)
tasks.releaseNotes:
What's new in Version 1.0:
 Added new service connection type input for easy selection of Azure AKS cluster.
 Replaced output variable input with output variables section that we had added in all tasks.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: connectionType
inputs.label: Service connection type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a service connection type.

inputs.name: kubernetesServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Kubernetes service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Kubernetes service connection.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription, which contains Azure Container Registry.Note: To configure new service connection, select the Azure subscription from the list and click 'Authorize'. If your subscription is not listed or if you want to use an existing Service Principal, you can setup an Azure service connection using 'Add' or 'Manage' button.

inputs.name: azureResourceGroup
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure resource group.

inputs.name: kubernetesCluster
inputs.label: Kubernetes cluster
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure managed cluster.

inputs.name: useClusterAdmin
inputs.label: Use cluster admin credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use cluster administrator credentials instead of default cluster user credentials.

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.label: Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the namespace for the kubectl command by using the –namespace flag. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will run in the default namespace.

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select or specify a kubectl command to run.

inputs.name: useConfigurationFile
inputs.label: Use configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use Kubernetes configuration with the kubectl command. An inline script, filename, directory, or URL to Kubernetes configuration files can be provided.

inputs.name: configurationType
inputs.label: Configuration type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of Kubernetes configuration for kubectl command. It can be a file path or an inline script.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: File path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Filename, directory, or URL to kubernetes configuration files that will be used with the commands.

inputs.name: inline
inputs.label: Inline configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Inline deployment configuration for kubectl command

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to the specified kubectl command.

inputs.name: secretType
inputs.label: Type of secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create/update a generic or docker imagepullsecret. Select dockerRegistry to create/update the imagepullsecret of the selected registry. An imagePullSecret is a way to pass a secret that contains a container registry password to the Kubelet so it can pull a private image on behalf of your Pod.

inputs.name: secretArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in secret.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: containerRegistryType
inputs.label: Container registry type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Container registry type. The task can use Azure Subscription details to work with an Azure Container registry. Other standard Container registries are also supported.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker registry service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpointForSecrets
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription, which contains Azure Container Registry. Note: To configure new service connection, select the Azure subscription from the list and click 'Authorize'. If your subscription is not listed or if you want to use an existing Service Principal, you can setup an Azure service connection using 'Add' or 'Manage' button.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure container registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry which will be used for pulling container images and deploying applications to the Kubernetes cluster. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: secretName
inputs.label: Secret name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the secret. You can use this secret name in the Kubernetes YAML configuration file.

inputs.name: forceUpdate
inputs.label: Force update secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the secret if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: configMapName
inputs.label: ConfigMap name
inputs.helpMarkDown: ConfigMaps allow you to decouple configuration artifacts from image content to keep containerized applications portable.

inputs.name: forceUpdateConfigMap
inputs.label: Force update configmap
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the configmap if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: useConfigMapFile
inputs.label: Use file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create a ConfigMap from an individual file, or from multiple files by specifying a directory.

inputs.name: configMapFile
inputs.label: ConfigMap file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a file or directory that contains the configMaps

inputs.name: configMapArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in configMap.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: versionOrLocation
inputs.label: Kubectl
inputs.helpMarkDown: kubectl is a command line interface for running commands against Kubernetes clusters.

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version Spec of version to get.  Examples: 1.7.0, 1.x.0, 4.x.0, 6.10.0

inputs.name: checkLatest
inputs.label: Check for latest version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Always checks online for the latest available version (stable.txt) that satisfies the version spec. This is typically false unless you have a specific scenario to always get latest. This will cause it to incur download costs when potentially not necessary, especially with the hosted build pool.

inputs.name: specifyLocation
inputs.label: Path to kubectl
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to the kubectl.exe

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for the Kubectl command.

inputs.name: outputFormat
inputs.label: Output format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output format.

tasks.name: AzureIoTEdge
tasks.description: Build and deploy an Azure IoT Edge image
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: advanced_deploy
groups.visibleRule: action = Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select an Azure IoT Edge action.
 **Build module images** will only build modules (You can use it to check compilation error).
 **Push module images** will push modules to container registry.
 **Deploy to IoT Edge devices** will deploy the generated deployment file to IoT Hub. (We recommend to put **Deploy** task in release pipeline).

inputs.name: deploymentFilePath
inputs.label: Deployment file
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the deployment json file.
 If this task is in **release pipeline**, you need to set the location of deployment file in artifact.(The default value works for most conditions).
 If this task is in **build pipeline**, you need to set it to the path of **Path of output deployment file**.
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure subscription contains IoT Hub
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an **Azure subscription** that contains IoT Hub
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: iothubname
inputs.label: IoT Hub name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the **IoT Hub**
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: deploymentid
inputs.label: IoT Edge deployment ID
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Input the **IoT Edge Deployment ID**, if ID exists, it will be overridden.
 Up to 128 lowercase letters, numbers and the following characters are allowed [ -:+%_#*?!(),=@;' ].
 Check more information for [Azure IoT Edge deployment](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment)

inputs.name: priority
inputs.label: IoT Edge deployment priority
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Set the **priority** to a positive integer to resolve deployment conflicts: when targeted by multiple deployments a device will use the one with highest priority or (in case of two deployments with the same priority) latest creation time.
 Check more information for [Azure IoT Edge deployment](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment)

inputs.name: deviceOption
inputs.label: Choose single/multiple device
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to deploy to single or multiple(by tags) devices
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: deviceId
inputs.label: IoT Edge device ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Input the IoT Edge **device ID**

inputs.name: targetcondition
inputs.label: IoT Edge device target condition
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Input the **target condition** of devices you would like to deploy. Do not use double quote. Example: **tags.building=9 and tags.environment='test'**.
 Check more information for [Azure IoT Edge deployment](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment)

inputs.name: containerregistrytype
inputs.label: Container registry type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select a **Container Registry Type**.
 **Azure Container Registry** for ACR and **Generic Container Registry** for generic registries including docker hub.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a generic **Docker registry connection**. Required for **Build and Push**.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an **Azure Container Registry**

inputs.name: templateFilePath
inputs.label: .template.json file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path of Azure IoT Edge solution **.template.json**. This file defines the modules and routes in Azure IoT Edge solution, file name must end with **.template.json**
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build module images || action = Push module images || action = Generate deployment manifest

inputs.name: defaultPlatform
inputs.label: Default platform
inputs.helpMarkDown: In your **.template.json**, you can leave the modules platform unspecified. For these modules, the **default platform** will be used.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build module images || action = Push module images || action = Generate deployment manifest

inputs.name: fillRegistryCredential
inputs.label: Add registry credential to deployment manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add registry credential for pushing docker images to deployment manifest

inputs.name: deploymentManifestOutputPath
inputs.label: Output path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The output path of generated deployment manifest

inputs.name: validateGeneratedDeploymentManifest
inputs.label: Validate the schema of generated deployment manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail this step if the generated deployment manifest does not pass schema validation. You can search `Azure IoT Edge deployment` in [JSON Schema Store](http://schemastore.org/json/) to find latest schema.

inputs.name: bypassModules
inputs.label: Bypass module(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the module(s) that you **DO NOT** need to build(or push) in the .template.json, specify module names and separate with comma.
 Example: if you have 2 modules **SampleModule1,SampleModule2** in your .template.json, you want to just build or push **SampleModule1**, then you set the bypass modules as **SampleModule2**. Leave empty if you would like to build all the modules in .template.json.

tasks.name: ServiceFabricComposeDeploy
tasks.description: Deploy a Docker Compose application to an Azure Service Fabric cluster
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: serviceConnectionName
inputs.label: Cluster Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Service Fabric service connection to be used to connect to the cluster. Choose 'Manage' to register a new service connection.

inputs.name: composeFilePath
inputs.label: Compose File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the compose file that is to be deployed. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) and wildcards can be used in the path.

inputs.name: applicationName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the application being deployed.

inputs.name: registryCredentials
inputs.label: Registry Credentials Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose if/how credentials for the docker registry will be provided.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpointName
inputs.label: Docker Registry Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. If a certificate matching the Server Certificate Thumbprint in the Cluster Service Connection is installed on the build agent, it will be used to encrypt the password; otherwise the password will not be encrypted.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription

inputs.name: registryUserName
inputs.label: Registry User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username for the Docker registry

inputs.name: registryPassword
inputs.label: Registry Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the Docker registry. If the password is not encrypted, it is recommended that you use a custom release pipeline secret variable to store it.

inputs.name: passwordEncrypted
inputs.label: Password Encrypted
inputs.helpMarkDown: It is recommended to encrypt your password using [Invoke-ServiceFabricEncryptText](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-application-secret-management#encrypt-application-secrets). If you do not, and a certificate matching the Server Certificate Thumbprint in the Cluster Service Connection is installed on the build agent, it will be used to encrypt the password; otherwise an error will occur.

inputs.name: upgrade
inputs.label: Upgrade
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upgrade an existing deployment rather than removing it.

inputs.name: deployTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Deploy Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for deploying the application.

inputs.name: removeTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Remove Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for removing an existing application.

inputs.name: getStatusTimeoutSec
inputs.label: Get Status Timeout (s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout in seconds for getting the status of an existing application.

tasks.name: AndroidSigning
tasks.description: Sign and align Android APK files
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: files
inputs.label: APK Files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from the repo root to the APK(s) you want to sign. You can use wildcards to specify multiple files. For example, `**/bin/*.apk` for all .APK files in the 'bin' subfolder.

inputs.name: jarsign
inputs.label: Sign the APK
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to sign the APK with a provided keystore file. Unsigned APKs can only run in an emulator. APKs must be signed to run on a device.

inputs.name: keystoreFile
inputs.label: Keystore File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the file path to the keystore file that should be used to sign the APK. It can either be checked into source control or placed on the build machine directly by an administrator. It is recommended to encrypt the keystore file in source control and use the 'Decrypt File' task to decrypt the file during the build.

inputs.name: keystorePass
inputs.label: Keystore Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the password for the provided keystore file. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: keystoreAlias
inputs.label: Alias
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the alias that identifies the public/private key pair to be used in the keystore file.

inputs.name: keyPass
inputs.label: Key Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the key password for the alias and keystore file. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: jarsignerArguments
inputs.label: Jarsigner Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide any options to pass to the jarsigner command line. Default is: -verbose -sigalg MD5withRSA -digestalg SHA1

inputs.name: zipalign
inputs.label: Zipalign
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select if you want to zipalign your package. This reduces the amount of RAM consumed by an app.

inputs.name: zipalignLocation
inputs.label: Zipalign Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the location of the zipalign executable used during signing. This defaults to the zipalign found in the Android SDK version folder that your application builds against.

tasks.name: DownloadPipelineArtifact
tasks.description: Downloads an artifact associated with a pipeline
tasks.helpMarkDown: Download named artifact from a pipeline to a local path.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: pipelineId
inputs.label: The specific pipeline to download from
inputs.helpMarkDown: The pipeline to download from. Target the current pipeline if left blank.

inputs.name: artifactName
inputs.label: The name of artifact to download.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of artifact to download. The artifact must be a pipeline artifact.

inputs.name: targetPath
inputs.label: Path to download to
inputs.helpMarkDown: The folder path to download the artifact to. This can be a fully-qualified path or a path relative to the root of the repository. Wildcards are not supported. [Variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988) are supported. If the folder doesn't exist it will be created.

outputVariables.name: BuildNumber
outputVariables.description:
Stores the build number of the pipeline artifact source.
Please note that in fact it returns BuildId due to backward compatibility

[More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/devops/pipelines/build/variables?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml#build-variables-devops-services)

tasks.name: DownloadPipelineArtifact
tasks.description: Download build and pipeline artifacts
tasks.helpMarkDown: Download one or more published build or pipeline artifacts.
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: source
inputs.label: Download artifacts produced by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by the current pipeline run, or from a specific pipeline run.

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: The project from which to download the pipeline artifacts.

inputs.name: pipeline
inputs.label: Build pipeline
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the build pipeline name.

inputs.name: preferTriggeringPipeline
inputs.label: When appropriate, download artifacts from the triggering build.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, this build task will try to download artifacts from the triggering build. If there is no triggering build from the specified pipeline, it will download artifacts from the build specified in the options below.

options.latestFromBranch: Latest from specific branch and specified Build Tags

inputs.name: runBranch
inputs.label: Branch name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify to filter on branch/ref name, for example: ```refs/heads/develop```.

inputs.name: runId
inputs.label: Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: The build from which to download the artifacts.

inputs.name: tags
inputs.label: Build Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma-delimited list of tags. Only builds with these tags will be returned.

inputs.name: allowPartiallySucceededBuilds
inputs.label: Download artifacts from partially succeeded builds.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, this build task will try to download artifacts whether the build is succeeded or partially succeeded.

inputs.name: allowFailedBuilds
inputs.label: Download artifacts from failed builds.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, this build task will try to download artifacts whether the build is succeeded or failed.

inputs.name: artifact
inputs.label: Artifact name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the artifact to download. If left empty, it will download all artifacts associated to the pipeline run.

inputs.name: patterns
inputs.label: Matching patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: One or more file matching patterns (new line delimited) that limit which files get downloaded.

inputs.name: path
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory to download the artifact files to. Can be relative to the pipeline workspace directory or absolute. If multi-download option is applied (by leaving an empty artifact name), a sub-directory will be created for each.

inputs.label: Build

inputs.name: itemPattern

inputs.name: downloadPath
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path on the agent machine where the artifacts will be downloaded.

outputVariables.name: pythonLocation
outputVariables.description: The directory of the installed Python distribution. Use this in subsequent tasks to access this installation of Python.

tasks.name: UsePythonVersion
tasks.description: Use the specified version of Python from the tool cache, optionally adding it to the PATH
tasks.helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=871498) or [see the Python documentation](https://www.python.org/doc/)
tasks.author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version range or exact version of a Python version to use, using semver's version range syntax. [More information](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=2006180)

inputs.name: disableDownloadFromRegistry
inputs.label: Disable downloading releases from the GitHub registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to disable downloading missing python version from the [Github Actions registry](https://github.com/actions/python-versions). Check this if you only want to use local pre-installed python.

inputs.name: allowUnstable
inputs.label: Allow downloading unstable releases
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allow downloading unstable python versions from [Github Actions python versions registry](https://github.com/actions/python-versions).

inputs.name: githubToken
inputs.label: GitHub token for GitHub Actions python registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: GitHub token is needed to prevent anonymous requests limit to the [Github Actions python versions registry](https://github.com/actions/python-versions). Leaving this empty may cause download failures. Not needed if you only use locally installed python.

inputs.name: addToPath
inputs.label: Add to PATH
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to prepend the retrieved Python version to the PATH environment variable to make it available in subsequent tasks or scripts without using the output variable.

inputs.name: architecture
inputs.label: Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target architecture (x86, x64) of the Python interpreter.

inputs.name: ScriptType

inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script. Should be fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory.

inputs.name: Inline
inputs.label: Inline Script

# You can write your PowerShell scripts inline here. 
# You can also pass predefined and custom variables to this script using arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the script to execute.

inputs.name: ScriptArguments
